title: Running Abimo
Running Abimo
code: abimo_data <- kwb.abimo::abimo_input_2019  # Have a look at the column types. IMPORTANT: Modifications must not change the # types! str(abimo_data)  # Assigning a value of e.g. 600 to an integer column converts the column # type to double (floating point)!  typeof(abimo_data$REGENJA) # integer  abimo_data$REGENJA <- 600  # run_abimo() will complain now... kwb.abimo::run_abimo(input_data = abimo_data) # Error: Column 'REGENJA' does not have the expected type (integer)!  # Really? typeof(abimo_data$REGENJA) # now double  # Problem: By assigning 600, the type was implicitly converted to double. # Use "L" to indicate integer values (or use as.numeric()) abimo_data$REGENJA <- 600L  # Or e.g. abimo_data$REGENJA <- as.integer(1.05 * kwb.abimo::abimo_input_2019$REGENJA)  typeof(abimo_data$REGENJA) # now integer (again)

what: Run Abimo with the modified data
title: Running Abimo
Running Abimo
code: # Create a configurator object from a Abimo configuration file config <- kwb.abimo::create_configurator("~/qt-projects/abimo/data/config.xml")  # Provide xpath expressions as a means of addressing the single config elements xpaths <- kwb.abimo::get_xpaths()  # Get/set Infiltrationsfaktoren using the xpath expressions... xp <- xpaths$Infiltrationsfaktoren  config$get(xp$Dachflaechen) config$set(xp$Dachflaechen, 0.6) config$get(xp$Dachflaechen) # check the change  config$get(xp$Belaglsklasse1) config$set(xp$Belaglsklasse1, 0.99) config$get(xp$Belaglsklasse1) # check the change  # Get/set Bagrovwerte ... xp <- xpaths$Bagrovwerte # ...  # Get/set ErgebnisNachkommaStellen... xp <- xpaths$ErgebnisNachkommaStellen # ...  # Get/set Diverse ... xp <- xpaths$Diverse config$get(xp$BERtoZero) config$set(xp$BERtoZero, "true")  config$get(xp$NIEDKORRF) config$set(xp$NIEDKORRF, 1.23)  # Check the changes config$get(xp$BERtoZero) config$get(xp$NIEDKORRF)  # More complicated: variable node sets  # Modify existing nodes xp <- xpaths$PotentielleVerdunstung config$get_nodes(xp) config$modify_node(xp, i = 1L, bezirke = "123-125", etp = 123, etps = 234) config$modify_node(xp, 6, etp = "666") config$get_nodes(xp) # check the changes  xp <- xpaths$PotentielleVerdunstung config$get_nodes(xp) #config$modify_node(xp, ...)  # TODO: Add/remove nodes

what: Run Abimo with the modified configuration
title: Running Abimo
text: Internally, new config_<date-time-string>.xml file created temporary folder:
code: result <- kwb.abimo::run_abimo(   input_data = kwb.abimo::abimo_input_2019,   config = config )  head(result) dir(tempdir())

what: Manually save configuration object to XML
title: Running Abimo
text: may create config files config objects using save(): something goes wrong, may compare created xml file original file, e.g. using TortoiseSVN->Diff…
code: new_xml_file <- config$save(name = "config_tmp.xml") # Open the folder containing the xml file kwb.utils::hsOpenWindowsExplorer(dirname(new_xml_file))

title:
R Package with Functions for Working with Water Balance
    Model ABIMO
text: details install KWB-R packages checkout installation tutorial.
code: ### Optionally: specify GitHub Personal Access Token (GITHUB_PAT) ### See here why this might be important for you: ### https://kwb-r.github.io/kwb.pkgbuild/articles/install.html#set-your-github_pat  # Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "mysecret_access_token")  # Install package "remotes" from CRAN if (! require("remotes")) {   install.packages("remotes", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org") }  # Install KWB package 'kwb.abimo' from GitHub remotes::install_github("KWB-R/kwb.abimo")

title: Helper function: replace value — replace_value
text: returns string modified parameter = value

title: Helper function: replace value — replace_value
code: ### Simple string string <- '<item bezirke="15,16,18,19,20" etp="807" etps="600" />' replace_value(string, new_value = 100, parameter = "etp") #> [1] "<item bezirke=\"15,16,18,19,20\" etp=\"100\" etps=\"600\" />" replace_value(string, new_value = 100, parameter = "etps") #> [1] "<item bezirke=\"15,16,18,19,20\" etp=\"807\" etps=\"100\" />" ### Default ABIMO config config <- readLines(kwb.abimo::default_config()) replace_value(config, new_value = 100, parameter = "etp") #>  [1] "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>"                                                                 #>  [2] "<sections>"                                                                                                 #>  [3] "\t<comment>" ist der Dokumentation von Abimo entnehmen."                                       #>  [6] "\t</comment>"                                                                                               #>  [7] "\t<section name=\"Infiltrationsfaktoren\">"                                                                 #>  [8] "\t\t<item key=\"Dachflaechen\"   value=\"0.00\" />" value=\"0.30\" />"                                                         #> [11] "\t\t<item key=\"Belaglsklasse3\" value=\"0.60\" />"                                                         #> [12] what: Run Abimo with Input Data or Input File — run_abimo
title: Run Abimo with Input Data or Input File — run_abimo
text: Run Abimo Input Data Input File

title: Run Abimo with Input Data or Input File — run_abimo
code: run_abimo(   input_file = NULL,   input_data = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   config_file = NULL,   config = NULL,   tag = "v3.3.0" )

title: Run Abimo with Input Data or Input File — run_abimo
text: input_file path input dbf file input_data data frame temporaryinput file generated output_file path output file. default output file name input file "_result" appended config_file optional. Path config.xml file config optional. Configuration object class "abimoConfig", returned create_configurator. given, config_file ignored. tag version tag Abimo release used, see https://github.com/KWB-R/abimo/releases

title: Run Abimo with Input Data or Input File — run_abimo
text: data frame, read dbf file created Abimo.exe
